title: The U.S. Consumer Looks Healthy. Here Are the Weak Links That Should Worry Investors.
text:
The U.S. consumer is a major driver of the economy, which is why high confidence readings lately have been comforting for those asking how long the bull market can last. Yet Morgan Stanley argues that some of the standard metrics for measuring consumer strength don’t tell the whole story, overlooking some weaker areas that could become problematic.

The back story. In many ways, the U.S. consumer appears to be in great shape. The unemployment rate continues to be near multi-decade lows, household savings rates are edging higher,...
description: While many consumers are doing well, this isn’t a case of the rising tide lifting all boats, as evidenced by the struggles of rental householders with lower income and credit scores, a Morgan Stanley analyst says.
